summary: Expand TaskZen beyond basic task CRUD into additional productivity modules: task deletion after completion, reminder/notifications, a Study Zone for subjects/assignments, and a Focus Mode that can enable notifications.
architectural_notes: Visual style: minimal, calm/devotional; soft saffron/white/cream palette; rounded cards; soft shadows; modern clean typography; clutter-free layout.
Move from single-page landing architecture to multi-page routing/navigation with separate views.
Add task creation flow (form + validation) and persistent task state (local storage or backend TBD).
Provide the task-completed animation as a framework-agnostic vanilla HTML/CSS/JS widget (no external libs) with an exported function/hook to trigger it from the app’s task-completed event.
Store the 100 Hindi inspirational quotes in a JS array exactly as provided; randomly select one per completion; show in centered popup with fade-in; auto-hide after 4 seconds.
Product scope now includes reminders/notifications and additional modules (Study Zone with subjects/assignments; Focus Mode notification behavior), beyond basic task list/add flows.
known_issues: User reports inability to add tasks and that everything is on a single page; expects multi-page app behavior.

existing_features.title: Create a single-page marketing landing page for a to-do list app named “TaskZen” with a clean, minimal, calm, devotional aesthetic inspired by Premanand Ji Maharaj, using a warm palette of soft saffron, white, and cream tones.

Implement the required landing page sections in order: (1) Hero with headline “TaskZen — Where Productivity Meets Peace”, (2) Features section listing: Work Zone, Study Zone, Daily Planner, Focus Mode, Gentle Reminders, Cloud Sync, (3) About section describing how the app blends productivity with spiritual calm, (4) Work & Study sections showing organized task categories, (5) Focus Mode section presenting a meditative, distraction-free design, (6) Philosophy section containing a simple spiritual quote about clarity and focus, (7) Call-to-Action section inviting users to “Start Your Journey”.
Use rounded cards, soft shadows, warm tones, and a user-friendly layout across the landing page; ensure consistent component styling, spacing, and responsive behavior using Tailwind CSS.

Establish and apply one coherent visual theme system (color tokens, type scale, spacing rhythm, button styles) that reinforces a peaceful, devotional app-style experience without adding extra product features beyond the landing page.

Add generated static visual assets that match the page’s calm devotional aesthetic (subtle background texture and a simple TaskZen mark) and render them in the landing page from the frontend’s public static assets directory (frontend/public/assets/generated).
Refactor the frontend from a single-page-only landing page into a multi-page app experience with client-side routing, so core areas are on separate pages instead of one long page.
Implement core task creation and listing UI: add a dedicated page/view to create a task and a separate page/view that lists tasks.
Connect the new Tasks/Add Task pages to the backend using the existing actor/query setup, using React Query for loading and mutation states.

Implement a reusable “Task Completed Flash Animation” UI component for the TaskZen React app that triggers when a task is successfully marked completed, showing: (1) a smooth white-gold flash/glow effect, (2) a centered quote popup, (3) fade-in text, (4) responsive modern clean UI, and (5) auto-hide after 4 seconds.

Store the provided Hindi inspirational quotes in a frontend array exactly as written (no edits to punctuation or wording) and randomly select exactly ONE quote to display each time the task-completed animation is triggered.

Provide three code deliverables inside the repo for the “Task Completed Flash Animation” that can be reused outside TaskZen without external libraries: (1) a full standalone HTML+CSS+JS example, (2) a reusable component-style version (vanilla JS/CSS that can be embedded), and (3) a minimal snippet version. These deliverables must not depend on any external libraries.

Add clear in-repo instructions for connecting the animation to a “task completed” event, including the exact integration point used in TaskZen (when completion mutation succeeds) and a generic vanilla-JS example for other websites.

Make the landing page’s primary feature options (at minimum: Work Zone, Study Zone, Daily Planner, Focus Mode, Gentle Reminders, Cloud Sync) touch-friendly and accessible by adding clear interactive affordances (tap/click feedback), keyboard focus styles, and semantic click targets without changing the app’s feature scope.
Add a delete option in the Tasks UI for completed tasks so users can remove completed tasks from their list.
Implement a task reminder feature that lets a user set/clear an optional reminder time for a task and persists it in the backend.
When a reminder becomes due while the app is open, notify the user in-app and (when permitted) via the browser Notifications API; provide a clear UI prompt/flow to request notification permission.
Add a Study Zone module where users can create subjects and add assignments under each subject; persist all Study Zone data in the backend with per-user access control.

Add a Focus Mode page with a toggle that enables notification behavior while Focus Mode is active (i.e., reminders should prefer browser notifications when permission is granted) and presents a distraction-minimized UI.

new_feature_requests.summary: Implement core to-do functionality: allow users to add tasks (basic task creation UI + state handling).
Refactor from a single-page layout to a multi-page app experience with separate pages/views (e.g., tasks list, add task, other sections) using routing/navigation.
Add backend support for storing and retrieving tasks on the Internet Computer, so tasks persist and can be fetched by the frontend.

Add a reusable “Task Completed Flash Animation” UI component (vanilla HTML/CSS/JS, no libraries) that shows a smooth white-gold flash/glow, then a centered responsive quote popup with fade-in text; selects 1 random quote from a stored Hindi quotes array; auto-hides after 4 seconds; provide full page code + reusable component + snippet + instructions to hook into task-completed event.
Ensure all main TaskZen options/sections (e.g., Study Zone, Daily Planner) are interactive/touch-friendly (clickable/tappable) and behave as intended across devices.
Add a delete option after a task is completed (allow users to remove completed tasks).
Add a reminder feature to remind users about tasks (reminder scheduling + user notifications).
Add a Study Zone module where users can add subjects and track assignments per subject.
Add Focus Mode behavior to enable notifications while in Focus Mode.
Add backend support for deleting tasks, with permissions enforced so a user can delete only their own tasks (admins may delete any task).
